steps.description: Customer opens the the provider app and runs automated Wi‑Fi diagnostics to identify intermittent connectivity issues.
steps.businessRationale: App diagnostics reduce support centre load and operational cost; quick results improve customer satisfaction and reduce churn.

steps.description: App provides step-by-step troubleshooting such as router reboot, channel optimisation, and interference checks.
steps.businessRationale: Effective troubleshooting reduces the need for agent contact and engineer visits, lowering operational cost.

steps.description: Customer escalates to live chat for deeper diagnostics and confirmation of issue severity.
steps.businessRationale: Chat support is cheaper than phone support; resolving issues here prevents costly engineer dispatch.

steps.description: Chat agent books an engineer visit after diagnostics confirm a line or router fault.
steps.businessRationale: Engineer scheduling requires backend availability checks; delays increase customer frustration and churn likelihood.

steps.description: Engineer visits the customer’s home, diagnoses the root cause, and resolves Wi‑Fi issues.
steps.businessRationale: Engineer visits are high-cost operations; duration impacts scheduling efficiency and customer satisfaction.

steps.description: the provider monitors Wi‑Fi stability and customer experience for 24 hours after engineer resolution.
steps.businessRationale: Post-fix monitoring reduces repeat faults and improves retention; early detection prevents additional support costs.
